isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - INPUT SHAFT

note.para: The input shaft can be installed without disassembling the transmission.

step1.para: Lubricate all the parts in the oil that is used in the transmission. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

Align the splines of the input shaft with the splines inside the main drive gear. Install the input shaft in the main drive gear. Install the snap ring that holds the input shaft in the main drive gear. Install the spacer on the input shaft ( Figure 303).

figure.caption: Figure 303. Install Input Shaft In Main Drive Gear

step1.para: Install the outer snap ring in the groove on the bearing ( Figure 304).

caution.para: Put the tool or tube on the inner race of the bearing. If tools are used in any other place on the bearing, the bearing will be damaged.

step1.para: Put the bearing over the input shaft and in the case. Use a rubber or plastic mallet and suitable bearing driver to install the bearing on the input shaft. The bearing is correctly installed when the snap ring touches the case ( Figure 305).

figure.caption: Figure 305. Install Bearing on Input Shaft

step1.para: Install the inner snap ring that fastens the bearing on the input shaft ( Figure 306).

Use Loctite Master Gasket Sealant #00203 or equivalent, and a sealant dispenser to put a new sealant pattern for the input bearing retainer on the case in the pattern shown in Figure 307. Refer to INSTALLING THE SEALANT section.
Install the bearing retainer on the case. Make sure the oil passage in the retainer is aligned with the oil hole in the case (Figure 308).
Install the bolts and washers for the retainer. Tighten the bolts to 88 to 115 Nm (65 to 85 ft-lbs.) (Figure 308).

figure.caption: Figure 308. Install Bearing Retainer On Case
